SERIOUS INQUIRES ONLY PLEASE:
Peaceful and serene 1-bedroom (sleeps 4) tree house over looking Ho`omaluhia Botanical Gardens and the Koolau Mountains.
AT LEAST ONE MONTH RENTAL REQUIRED ($2650); AFTER ONE MONTH, WEEKLY RATE IS $950 AND DAILY RATE IS $150. Email with requested time-frame and I`ll let you know the quote for requested dates.
This Oasis has breathtaking views of the Hoomaluhia Botanical Gardens and the Koolau Mountains.
Park in the driveway and walk into your Hawaiian Hale! A single level home of 1000 sq ft interior with one bedroom, large open kitchen, front room, dining room, and living room with desk, one full bathroom with jacuzzi bath tub, and large deck and bbq area. There is one parking space in the driveway and plenty of parking on the street, entryway has a few stairs to access the front door.
The Space:
This Oasis is an attached, furnished Hale with breathtaking views of the Ho`omaluhia Botanical Gardens and the Ko`olau Mountains. Perfect for those who enjoy nature and hearing the bird`s sing, and for those who like peace and quiet, but also enjoys to be conveniently located!
-The overall décor is mid-century modern meet eclectic traveler.
-In the bedroom there is a large comfy queen sized sleigh bed with fine linens and has air conditioning.
-There is a daybed in the front room with a room separator suitable for one person.
-Also in the living room there is a single pull-out bed with its own room separator for privacy.
Guest Access:
Furnishings include couch, daybed, large sitting chair/single bed, desk, closet space, lighting, large dining room table seating up to 15 comfortably with table inserts utilized, comfy queen bed, large flat screen TV with cable and internet provided, air conditioner, patio set, grill, and other misc. furnishings.
Kitchen is fully loaded with all one would need.
Interaction with Guests:
We are right next door so if you need anything we are available. Generally we give our guests complete privacy and interaction is based mostly on guest`s wishes and the occasional running into each other in the front of the house (back is private).
The Neighborhood:
We are super close to lots of great hiking, golfing, and Kailua and Lanikai beaches are just up the road. We are 20 minutes to downtown, 20 minutes to the Pearl Harbor historical sites, 45 minutes to the North Shore. Neighborhood is safe, friendly and quiet.
Other Things to Note:
We do have a car available for rent most of the time and cleaning services available upon request.
No onsite laundry!
House Rules
No pets and no smoking inside, smoking on back deck is fine. No shoes inside, got to do it Hawai`i style! Be gentle to the living space and leave it well. Maintain reasonable noise levels.
Mahalo Nui Loa!

*The 1st & 2nd pictures were taken from the living room. This corner & end unit faces a small "forest" on a slow hill with a view, so there is no neighbor over there. Extremely quiet!

postings.body:
What a great opportunity while the interest rates are still low! When you buy the 2 houses and the 5000 square foot shop, your business can rent the shop from you or to someone else. Home occupations are allowed in this zoning. The shop rental is worth at least $2500. You can rent out the smaller house (currently rented for $1095/month) and live in the bigger house (probably $2000 rental value).
The house is located in Pierce County, just North of Lake Tapps in the Dierenger School District. Approximately 10 minutes to Hwy 18 or Hwy 167. Surrounded by acreage sized lots and bordered to the east by 1000`s of acres of open space, this 3 acre home site has a magnificent view of the White River valley, the Cascade Range and Mt. Rainier. Ospreys, Great Blue Herons and Bald Eagles soar over the valley and deer visit regularly.
One house is a 1250 square foot (approx.) rambler with a two car attached garage. It is classified by Pierce County as an Auxiliary Dwelling Unit (ADU). It has 3 bedrooms and 1 3/4 baths, a wood stove, vinyl windows and electric wall heaters. It has cathedral ceilings and crown molding in much of the house. It is currently being rented for $1095/month. It was extensively remodeled in 2001.
The main house is a 2850 square feet (approx.) two story with a 24`x 25` two car garage. The home has many unique features and architectural elements such as upgraded moldings, curved walls, curved crown molding, venetian plastered walls, 2 story cathedral entry and arched doorways. The uplights, can lights, pendants and sconces can be used to create to wonderfully varied lighting.
Walk through the formal dining room with its curved walls, past the walk-in pantry, into the kitchen where there is an expansive view of the Cascade Range. In the middle of the kitchen is a 5` x 18` curved island with seating for seven people facing the view, but plenty of room for a huge party. All the appliances, including a separate freezer, are stainless steel. The 36" Dacor range has six huge burners.
Centered in the family room, adjacent to the kitchen, is a gas fireplace. Double French doors lead outside.
The master bedroom and bathroom are located on the main floor. The bathroom counters, tub deck, shower and floor are travertine. The shower is surrounded by a curved glass block wall, with a 3/8 inch thick frameless glass door. The top of the line Kohler heated, jetted tub has chromatherapy lights. Wonderful lighting throughout.
Upstairs are two bedrooms, one full bath and an office with cathedral ceilings, soffit up and down lighting and a beautiful view of the river valley. IN ADDITION: There are two unfinished rooms. Either one could be made into an additional bedroom, OR one of the two rooms has rough plumbing in the walls for a full bath. These two rooms, if finished, would add approximately 480 square feet. The septic system permit was approved for a 4 bedroom house. The house is plumbed and wired for a built-in vacuum and wired for a security system. The house has infloor hydronic (hot water) heating throughout. There are four 66" x 120" granite slabs (2cm) available for the kitchen counter tops. This home was built in 2006.
The shop is approximately 5000 square feet. The main floor has two 8` x 8` overhead garage doors, two 9` x 9` overhead garage doors and one 3` x 6`8" personnel door. The shop floor is concrete. Rough plumbing is installed for a ¾ bath. The shop has two 200 amp panels (single phase power). It has a 1 ton chain hoist trolley running on a seventeen foot "I" beam. The shop is plumbed to a 500 gallon propane tank. The second story is accessed by outside stairs. The building has a phone line and a monitored fire alarm.
Both houses and the shop are served by the private well. There is an RV hookup.
The total price is $645,000. Possible lease/option. Possibly trade my $225,000 equity for real estate or ?
Key words: Cabinet, upholstery, sheet metal, gutter, furniture, auto body, small engine repair, welding, light manufacturing, home occupation, dry storage, fabrication, office, food prep, floral, wholesale florist, fish farming?

Seeking a 3rd Artist/Designer/Creative to share my 525sq/ft bright studio in Brooklyn Fireproof. I am a mid 30`s photographer/sculptor. A good fit would maintain an organized workspace and have a slightly varying schedule, in addition to a nice shared dynamic. (no toxic practices, sorry)
The Studio: is located on 4th floor with huge eastern windows, 14ft ceilings with original tin, fresh-painted walls, ceiling fans, and wood floors. (Note: I`m in process of painting floors off-white which will make space even brighter.)
The Building: Brooklyn Fireproof is a renowned building/community and a central figure in Bushwick Open Studios. Located just 2 blocks from Morgan L. Cafe/Bar and Gallery/Event space is situated on the ground floor. The building is very well maintained, with intercom, 4 bathrooms on the floor, 2 slop sinks, and freight elevator. Garbage and recycling bins provided per floor.
Available portion of studio is the back quadrant by the doorway and includes 15ft length of wall space x 7ft wide. (Still very bright from the wall of windows)
Rent: $375 (includes utilities and wifi)
(1 month rent + 1 month security required)
Available: Immediately or August 1st
Open to shorter term shares, as well as longer if a nice fit.
Please send me links to your work and a bit about your working practice/schedule. Thanks!
